oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Prüfung von Zuchtlinien der Weißen Lupine (Lupinus albus L.) auf Anthraknoseresistenz
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jacob, Irene
Deyerler, Manuel
Feuerstein, Ulf
Geißendörfer, Herbert
Heinz, Markus
Schweneker, Dörte
Urbatzka, Peer
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Breeding, genetics and propagation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: White lupin (Lupinus albus L.) is a protein plant adapted to the conditions of middle Europe. Presently, no variety with a sufficient resistance to anthracnose, caused by Colletotrichum lupini, is available, and cultivation of white lupins in Germany has hardly any relevance. Making this crop available for cultivation again would expand the range of domestic protein crops and increase the biological diversity on agriculturally used fields. To make this crop worth cultivated again, it is essential to develop white lupin varieties with a high resistance to anthracnose. The breeding lines tested in this study proofed to have a higher level of resistance towards anthracnose and are thus yielding higher compared to currently available varieties.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jacob, Irene; Deyerler, Manuel; Feuerstein, Ulf; Geißendörfer, Herbert; Heinz, Markus; Schweneker, Dörte and Urbatzka, Peer (2014) Prüfung von Zuchtlinien der Weißen Lupine (Lupinus albus L.) auf Anthraknoseresistenz. Paper at: 13. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Hochschule für nachhaltige Entwicklung Eberswalde, 17. - 20. März 2015.
